page.title: 2011 attack on the British Embassy in Iran

revision.text:
{{EngvarB|date=January 2014}} {{Use dmy dates|date=January 2014}} {{Infobox civil conflict | title = 2011 attack on the British Embassy in Tehran | image =
[[File:British Embassy Storming 03.jpg|300px]]

[[File:Tehran topo.svg|300px]]
[[File:Red pog.svg|7px]]
'''The attack site'''
| coordinates = {{coord|35|41|47|N|51|25|09|E|display=inline}} | date = 29 November 2011 | place = Jomhouri, [[Tehran]], Iran | howmany1 = Several thousand protesters{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} | methods = [[Demonstration (people)|Demonstrations]], rioting, [[online activism]], infiltration | injuries = ~20 Iranian protesters{{citation needed|date=December 2011}}
~3 British officials{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} | arrests = 12 Iranian protesters{{citation needed|date=December 2011}} }} The '''2011 attack on the [[Embassy of the United Kingdom, Tehran|British Embassy]] in Iran''' was a mob action on 29 November 2011 by a crowd of Iranian protesters who stormed the embassy and another British diplomatic compound in [[Tehran]], Iran, ransacking offices and stealing documents. One small building was set on fire during the incident and several people were injured.{{cite web |url=http://www.radionz.co.nz/news/world/92466/us-president-condemns-embassy-attack |title=US President condemns embassy attack |date=30 November 2011 |publisher=radionz.co.nz |accessdate=30 November 2011}} The Iranian government publicly condemned the violence.The Guardian, ''Iranian opposition student groups condemn storming of British embassy'', 1 December 2011 [https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/01/iranian-opposition-british-embassy-attack] ==Background== {{Main|Iran–United Kingdom relations}} The [[British government]] had imposed numerous sanctions on [[Iran]] regarding concerns over the [[Nuclear program of Iran|nature of Iran's nuclear program]]. Following the release of a November 2011 [[International Atomic Energy Agency]] report that documented weaponisation elements of Iran's nuclear activities, the British government banned all financial institutions in the United Kingdom doing business with their counterparts in Iran, including [[Central Bank of the Islamic Republic of Iran|Iran's central bank]].{{cite news|title=Iranian protesters storm UK embassy|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2011/11/20111129132554123213.html|accessdate=1 December 2011|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=29 November 2011}} Iran responded by approving a bill to downgrade its ties with the United Kingdom, including a requirement for both countries to withdraw their respective ambassadors.{{cite news|title=Iran council approves downgrading of UK ties|url=http://www.aljazeera.com/news/middleeast/2011/11/20111128134939254881.html|accessdate=1 December 2011|publisher=Al Jazeera|date=28 November 2011}} This was not the first time that Iran has called for downgrading ties with the United Kingdom.{{cite web|url=http://www.presstv.com/detail/174176.html |title=Iran to mull decreasing ties with UK |publisher=Press TV |date=11 April 2011 |accessdate=5 December 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.presstv.com/detail/175612.html |title=Iran warns UK against further meddling |publisher=Press TV |date=19 April 2011 |accessdate=5 December 2011}} ==Incursion== About 1,000 people gathered near the [[Embassy of the United Kingdom, Tehran|embassy]] to demand that the British ambassador be sent home immediately. The rally began quietly, but some participants stormed the building, breaking down the door, throwing around papers and replacing the British flag with an Iranian one.{{cite web |url=http://www.news8000.com/news/UK-condemns-Iranian-embassy-incursion/-/326/4838464/-/w89yq/-/index.html |title=UK condemns embassy incursion in Iran |date=29 November 2011 |publisher=news8000.com |accessdate=30 November 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120118081321/http://www.news8000.com/news/UK-condemns-Iranian-embassy-incursion/-/326/4838464/-/w89yq/-/index.html |archive-date=18 January 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }}{{cite web |url=http://www.weartv.com/template/inews_wire/wires.international/36b73d5f-weartv.com.shtml |title=Iranian students storm British Embassy in Tehran |date=30 November 2011 |publisher=weartv.com |accessdate=30 November 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120127104006/http://www.weartv.com/template/inews_wire/wires.international/36b73d5f-weartv.com.shtml |archive-date=27 January 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} The Iranian security forces initially did not intervene as protesters entered the British Embassy.{{cite news |url=https://www.nytimes.com/2011/11/30/world/middleeast/tehran-protesters-storm-british-embassy.html |title=Protesters Storm British Embassy in Tehran |date=29 November 2011 |work=The New York Times |accessdate=30 November 2011 |first1=Robert F. |last1=Worth |first2=Rick |last2=Gladstone}}{{cite web|url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15564655,00.html|title=Britain orders Iranian embassy closed, expels staff|publisher=Deutsche Welle|date=30 November 2011}}{{cite web|url=http://www.france24.com/en/20111129-iran-protesters-storm-british-embassy|title=Iran protesters storm British embassy|quote=The intrusion occurred as ranks of Iranian police in riot gear stood by, doing nothing.|date=29 November 2011|access-date=2 December 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111202005457/http://www.france24.com/en/20111129-iran-protesters-storm-british-embassy|archive-date=2 December 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} Protesters removed the mission's flag and ransacked offices.{{cite news | url=https://www.bloomberg.com/news/2011-11-29/iran-financial-sanctions-set-to-shrink-circle-of-foreign-buyers-of-crude.html | title=Iran Financial Sanctions Set to Shrink Circle of Foreign Buyers of Crude | publisher=Bloomberg | date=29 November 2011 | accessdate=30 November 2011 | author=DiPaola, Anthony | author2=Narayanan, Pratish}} The protesters chanted, "Death to America", "Death to England" and "Death to Israel", among other slogans. According to the [[British Ambassador to Iran]] [[Dominick Chilcott]], protesters rampaged through the embassy building, destroying paintings and furniture, spraying graffiti, smashing windows and starting fires. Seven embassy staff were seized by protesters but were eventually escorted out by police. The protesters also stole mobile phones and computers.{{cite news|url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2011/12/02/uk-iran-britain-ambassador-idUKTRE7B128920111202|author=Adrian Croft|title=UK envoy tells of fear as mob rampage in Iran embassy|date=2 December 2011|agency=Reuters}} [[British Prime Minister]] [[David Cameron]] described the incursion as "outrageous and indefensible" and demanded that Iran immediately ensure the safety of all British Embassy personnel. [[Secretary of State for Foreign and Commonwealth Affairs|Foreign Secretary]] [[William Hague]] said the "irresponsible action" had put the safety of diplomats and their families at risk and caused extensive damage to embassy property.{{cite web |url=http://www.ksat.com/news/nationalnews/UK-condemns-Iranian-embassy-incursion/-/478364/4838464/-/lurlkdz/-/index.html |title=UK condemns embassy incursion in Iran |date=29 November 2011 |publisher=ksat.com/news |accessdate=30 November 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120414205643/http://www.ksat.com/news/nationalnews/UK-condemns-Iranian-embassy-incursion/-/478364/4838464/-/lurlkdz/-/index.html |archive-date=14 April 2012 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} Some anti-UK students had gathered at the front of Gholhak Garden in the north of Tehran. They also pulled down a picture of [[Elizabeth II|the Queen]] and burned an embassy vehicle, as well as US, Israeli and UK flags. The protesters said they wanted to shut down the embassy. Protesters also targeted [[Gholhak Garden]], a British diplomatic compound in northern Tehran whose ownership has been a source of contention between Iranian and UK officials.{{cite web |ssrn=2766686 |title=Kings’ Dirty Operation: Concise Memos of My Cooperation with the CIA and Illuminati's Hell |date=14 April 2016 |author=Peiman Ghasemi |publisher=Social Science Research Network}}{{cite web |url=http://www.standupamericaus.org/middle-east-iran/iran-protesters-attack-uk-embassy-in-tehran/ |title=Iran protesters attack UK embassy in Tehran |date=29 November 2011 |publisher=standupamericaus.org |accessdate=30 November 2011 |archive-url=https://archive.is/20130113093805/http://www.standupamericaus.org/middle-east-iran/iran-protesters-attack-uk-embassy-in-tehran/ |archive-date=13 January 2013 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} Iran expressed regret over the attacks and police arrested 12 protesters. ===Perpetrators=== Iranian state media agencies and certain international news sources described the protests as a reaction of students against Britain's anti-Iran policies.{{cite news |title=Iranian opposition student groups condemn storming of British embassy |author=Saeed Kamali Dehghan |url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/dec/01/iranian-opposition-british-embassy-attack |newspaper=The Guardian |date=1 December 2011 |accessdate=1 December 2011 |location=London}}{{cite news |title=British embassy attack was state-sponsored, experts claim |url=http://www.dw-world.de/dw/article/0,,15566286,00.html |publisher=Deutsche Welle |date=30 November 2011 |accessdate=1 December 2011}} The demonstrators themselves issued an official statement, declaring, "Our actions are a spontaneous reaction of revolutionary students and were not ordered by any state organ." In a statement to the House of Commons on 30 November, Foreign Secretary William Hague said: "Iran is a country where Opposition leaders are under house arrest, more than 500 people have been executed so far this year and where genuine protest is ruthlessly stamped on. The idea that the Iranian authorities could not have protected our Embassy or that this assault could have taken place without some degree of regime consent is fanciful".{{cite web |url=https://www.gov.uk/government/news/foreign-secretary-statement-to-the-house-of-commons-on-british-embassy-tehran |title=Foreign Secretary statement to the House of Commons on British Embassy Tehran |publisher=Foreign and Commonwealth Office |date=30 November 2011 |accessdate=20 December 2016}} Some analysts, media sources and Iranian opposition groups assert that the attack was orchestrated by the Iranian authorities, hence the strong British reaction.{{cite news |title=UK embassy attack orchestrated by Iranian authorities: sources |author=Najah Mohamed Ali |url=http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/12/01/180268.html |publisher=Al Arabiya |date=1 December 2011 |accessdate=1 December 2011 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111201161931/http://english.alarabiya.net/articles/2011/12/01/180268.html |archive-date=1 December 2011 |dead-url=yes |df=dmy-all }} Al Jazeera's correspondent in Tehran, Dorsa Jabbari, reported that the Iranian police and various ministries had prior knowledge of the protest, which was organised by the student arm of the Basij. Police reportedly "stood back and let the protestors make their way into the compound". In the words of ''[[The Economist]]'', "This was the centre of the capital city . . . If the police had wanted to stop this, they could have flooded the compound with officers and rescued the British. The police, and whoever was pulling the strings behind the attack, chose not to intervene for a long while".{{cite news|url=https://www.economist.com/blogs/bagehot/2011/12/britain-and-iran |title=Britain and Iran: A very near miss for Britain's diplomats in Iran |work=The Economist |accessdate=5 December 2011 |date=2 December 2011}} Jabbari stated, "Any such action of this scale can never be independent in the Islamic Republic". Dominick Chilcott told the BBC, Iran is a country in which such action is only taken "with the acquiescence and the support of the state".{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-16010547|title=Attack on UK embassy in Iran 'had support of the state' |publisher=BBC |date=3 December 2011 |accessdate=3 December 2011}} ==Effect on international schools== The [[École Française de Téhéran]] (Tehran's French school) is located on property of the British embassy. It had its classes in session as the embassy attack occurred. Several windows at the [[German Embassy School Tehran]] (DBST), near the British embassy, were destroyed, and the French school, the German school, and the [[British School of Tehran]] (BST) closed indefinitely.Ya'ar, Chana. "[http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/150422#.Vfk1oPSZqVA International Schools Close in Tehran]" ([https://www.webcitation.org/6baBalIXy?url=http://www.israelnationalnews.com/News/News.aspx/150422 Archive]). ''[[Arutz Sheva]]'' (Israel National News). 12 June 2011. Retrieved on 16 September 2015. The school board of trustees of the BST voted to have the school permanently disestablished, with the end date being 31 December 2011. The DBST acquired the assets of the BST and established an international section in the former BST buildings."[https://web.archive.org/web/20120428005645/http://www.britishschooltehran.com/ To the Friends, Staff, Parents and Children of the British School, Tehran]". British School of Tehran. April 28, 2012. Retrieved on September 17, 2015. ==Reactions== ===Within Iran=== Iran's [[Ministry of Foreign Affairs (Iran)|Foreign Ministry]] expressed regret over the attack, calling it "unacceptable" and said that it happened "despite the efforts made by the Iranian Law Enforcement Police and reinforcement of the embassy guards". Iranian police arrested 12 protesters in connection with the attack.{{cite news|title=Iranian Foreign Ministry Regrets Raid on Britain's Embassy |url=http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=9007275493 |agency=[[Fars News Agency]] |date=30 November 2011 |dead-url=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20120601050206/http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=9007275493 |archivedate=1 June 2012 }} Two Iranian opposition student groups, [[Tahkim Vahdat]] and [[Advar Tahkim]], issued statements criticising the attack. Tahkim Vahdat said that those behind it were "not true representative of Iranian students, they were affiliated with the authorities in power". Iran's Deputy Police Chief Brigadier General Ahmad Reza Radan announced that police have started investigations into the details of the protests, in which angry self-driven protesters raided and occupied the British embassy and its garden in Northern Tehran.{{cite web | url=http://english2.farsnews.com/newstext.php?nn=9007275481 | title=Iranian Police Probing Details of Occupy Embassy Protests | date=30 November 2011 | agency=[[Fars News Agency]] | accessdate=4 May 2016 | id=FNA News number: 9007275481}} Iranian MP Parviz Sorouri, a senior member of the Majlis National Security and Foreign Policy Committee, said that "the British government's hasty decision to close down the Iranian Embassy in London has created a new situation for both sides. But the Iranian government will do its utmost to stand up for the rights of Iranian citizens living in Britain through the establishment of an interests section in London".{{cite news|title=It's humble pie or bitter fruit for Britain|url=http://www.mehrnews.com/en/newsdetail.aspx?NewsID=1475266|agency=[[Mehr News Agency]]|date=2 December 2011|access-date=3 December 2011|archive-url=https://archive.is/20130128162009/http://www.mehrnews.com/en/newsdetail.aspx?NewsID=1475266|archive-date=28 January 2013|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} {{expand section|date=December 2011}} Subsequently, the Sultanate of Oman agreed to act as a protecting power, representing the interests of Iran through its embassy in London. ===Within the United Kingdom=== [[File:William Hague 2010.jpg|thumb|150px|[[British Foreign Secretary]] [[William Hague]] condemned the attacks.]] Following the incident, the [[Foreign and Commonwealth Office]] issued a statement saying that "we are outraged by this. It is utterly unacceptable and we condemn it". Later that evening David Cameron described the Iranian Government's failure to protect the embassy as a "disgrace".{{cite web|url=http://www.fco.gov.uk/en/news/latest-news/?view=News&id=699379382 |title=Storming of British Embassy in Iran |publisher=Fco.gov.uk |accessdate=1 December 2011}} On 30 November 2011, during a speech to the [[House of Commons of the United Kingdom|House of Commons]], Foreign Secretary [[William Hague]] announced that the Iranian Ambassador to the [[Court of St. James's]], his ambassadorial staff and other Iranian diplomats had 48 hours to leave the United Kingdom. The foreign secretary also announced that he had closed the [[Embassy of the United Kingdom, Tehran|British Embassy]], and its staff and dependants had left Tehran. This brought the United Kingdom's relations with Iran to their lowest level, and both the Foreign Secretary and Prime Minister had warned of far more "serious consequences" towards Iran, for its failure to uphold its international obligations in line with the [[Vienna Convention on Diplomatic Relations|Vienna Convention]].{{cite news|author=James Reynolds |url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-politics-15966628 |title=UK to expel all Iranian diplomats over embassy attack |publisher=BBC |date=9 November 2011 |accessdate=1 December 2011}} Deputy Prime Minister [[Nick Clegg]] told the BBC's Sarah Rainsford that the UK's relationship with Iran had "taken a very serious knock" but that "It doesn't mean we're cutting off all diplomatic relations with Iran. It doesn't mean we are in any way lessening our determination to try to find a diplomatic solution to the nuclear question, which is immensely important to Europe and the whole world, and we will continue to work tirelessly to find a negotiated solution".{{cite news|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-16010547|title=Attack on UK embassy in Iran 'had support of the state |publisher=BBC |date=3 December 2011 |accessdate=3 December 2011}} In November 2013, Iran and the UK agreed to end the protecting power arrangements of Sweden and Oman and appointed non-resident ''charge d'affaires'' to conduct bilateral relations between London and Tehran. In June 2014, the UK announced that it intended to reopen its embassy in Tehran once practical arrangements had been completed and predicted that Iran would reopen its embassy in London. ===United Nations=== The [[United Nations Security Council]] condemned the attacks "in the strongest terms". ===United States=== United States Secretary of State [[Hillary Clinton]] described the attacks as an "affront" to the international community.[http://www.cbsnews.com/8301-202_162-57333536/uk-serious-consequences-for-iran-attack/?tag=cbsnewsMainColumnArea UK: "Serious consequences" for Iran attack]. ''[[CBS News]]''. 30 November 2011. Retrieved 30 November 2011. US Vice-President [[Joe Biden]] said he had no evidence the attack on the British embassy in Tehran was orchestrated by Iranian authorities, but it was another example of why the country was a "[[pariah state|pariah]]".{{cite news|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/12/01/us-usa-iran-biden-idUSTRE7B01VQ20111201 |title=Biden: No indication Iran orchestrated embassy attack|date=1 December 2011 |agency=Reuters |accessdate=3 December 2011}} ===EU member states=== France, Germany, Italy, and the Netherlands recalled their ambassadors to discuss the diplomatic matter, with Austria stating they are considering a similar decision.{{cite news|url=https://www.washingtonpost.com/world/norway-britain-withdrawing-embassy-staff-from-iran/2011/11/30/gIQAHR37BO_story.html|title=Iran faces increased isolation after attack on British Embassy|publisher=The [[Washington Post]]|date=30 November 2011|first1=Thomas|last1=Erdbrink|first2=Joby|last2=Warrick}}{{cite web|url=https://news.yahoo.com/blogs/envoy/uk-expels-iranian-diplomats-embassy-attacked-135908110.html|title=UK expels Iranian diplomats after embassy attack; French, German, Dutch envoys recalled |publisher=Yahoo! News|date=30 November 2011}} While not recalling its own ambassador, Sweden summoned the Iranian Ambassador to the Swedish Foreign Ministry.{{cite web|url=http://www.thelocal.se/37666/20111130/|title=Sweden summons Iran envoy after storming|publisher=The Local|date=30 November 2011}} Germany offered to act as a [[protecting power]] for the United Kingdom's diplomatic duties in Iran;{{cite news|title=UPDATE 8-UK expels Iran diplomats after embassy attack|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2011/11/30/iran-britain-embassy-idUSL5E7MU09B20111130|accessdate=30 November 2011|agency=Reuters|date=30 November 2011|author2=Mitra Amiri|first=Robin|last=Pomeroy}} Sweden took on those diplomatic duties as of July 2012.{{cite news | url=http://uk.reuters.com/article/2012/07/12/uk-britain-iran-sweden-idUKBRE86B19620120712 | title=Sweden to watch British interests in Iran | date=12 July 2012 | agency=Reuters | accessdate=8 September 2012 | author=Castle, Tim | author2=Shanley, Mia}} Hungary declined to recall its Ambassador to Iran following a meeting of EU Foreign Ministers on 1 December, saying it would cripple normal day-to-day operations due to its limited staff. However the Hungarian government joined its European allies in condemning the incident.{{cite news|title=Hungary keeps Ambassador in Iran|url=http://www.budapestreport.com/2011/12/02/hungary-keeps-ambassador-in-iran/|accessdate=3 December 2011|newspaper=The Budapest report|date=2 December 2011|author=Andras M. Badics|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20111207012844/http://www.budapestreport.com/2011/12/02/hungary-keeps-ambassador-in-iran/|archive-date=7 December 2011|dead-url=yes|df=dmy-all}} ===Russia and China=== Russia condemned the attack, stating that the actions were "unacceptable and deserve condemnation".{{cite web|url=http://rt.com/news/iranian-students-occupy-uk-embassy-481/|title=Iran attack: UK embassy stormed in Tehran|date=29 November 2011|publisher=RT|location=Russia}} China did not criticise Iran by name but stated that "the relevant action runs counter to international law and basic norms of international relations and should be handled appropriately."{{cite web|url=http://www.straitstimes.com/BreakingNews/World/Story/STIStory_739644.html|title=China refuses to criticise Iran by name for UK embassy attack|work=Straits Times |location=Singapore |date=30 November 2011}} ===Canada=== On 7 September 2012, Canada [[Canada–Iran relations#2012 embassy closure|closed its embassy in Iran]] and declared all remaining Iranian diplomats in Canada ''[[personae non gratae]]'', ordering them to leave the country within five days.{{cite news|last=Ljunggren|first=Davod|title=Canada closes Iran embassy, to expel remaining Iranian diplomats|url=https://www.reuters.com/article/2012/09/07/us-canada-iran-idUSBRE8860QC20120907|agency=Reuters|accessdate=7 September 2012|date=7 September 2012}} ==Reopening of the Embassy== In August 2015, nearly four years after the closure of the British Embassy in Tehran, and only weeks after reaching [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action|a nuclear deal]] with Iran, it was announced by Iranian Foreign Minister [[Mohammad Javad Zarif]] in a joint press conference with British Foreign Secretary [[Philip Hammond]] at the Foreign Ministry in Tehran that the embassy will be reopened as soon as possible. The new round of relations between the two nations are on the account of the [[Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action|JCPOA]] and in anticipation of strategic relations in the course of coming years. However, a number of Iranian students and people protested against the reopening of the British embassy on Sunday morning in the presence of Foreign Secretary Phillip Hammond according to [[Fars News Agency]]. {{cite web|url=http://english.farsnews.com/newstext.aspx?nn=13940601001345|title=Iranian Police Make Arrests to Prevent Protest Gathering against British Embassy Reopening|access-date=2016-03-22}} {{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-34031615|title=British embassy in Tehran reopens four years after closure}} {{cite web|url=http://time.com/4007668/iran-tehran-us-embassy-javad-zarif|title=Iran’s Foreign Minister Says It’s Too Early for the U.S. to Reopen Its Embassy in Tehran}} ==See also== {{Portal|Iran|United Kingdom}} * [[Iran hostage crisis]] * [[2011 attack on the Israeli Embassy in Egypt]] * [[2016 attack on the Saudi Embassy in Iran]] ==References== {{reflist|20em}} ==External links== *{{Commons category-inline|2011 attack on the British Embassy in Iran}} *[https://www.theguardian.com/world/2011/nov/30/britain-expels-iranian-diplomats-tehran Coverage at the ''Guardian''] {{Iran-United Kingdom relations}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Attack on the British Embassy in Iran, 2011}} [[Category:2011 controversies]] [[Category:2011 in international relations]] [[Category:2011 in Iran]] [[Category:2011 in the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Iran–United Kingdom relations]] [[Category:Attacks on diplomatic missions of the United Kingdom]] [[Category:Attacks on diplomatic missions in Iran|United Kingdom]] [[Category:21st century in Tehran]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox award | name = 2013 MTV Video Music Awards | image = 2013 MTV VMA Logo.png | imagesize = 250px | date = Sunday, {{start date|2013|8|25}} | location = [[Barclays Center]],
[[Brooklyn]], [[New York City]] | country = United States | website = {{url|http://www.mtv.com/vma/2013/}} | network = [[MTV]] | runtime = | most_awards = [[Justin Timberlake]] (4) | most_nominations = [[Justin Timberlake]] (6) | previous = [[2012 MTV Video Music Awards|2012]] | main = {{nowrap|[[MTV Video Music Award]]s}} | next = [[2014 MTV Video Music Awards|2014]] }} The '''2013 [[MTV Video Music Award]]s''' were held on August 25, 2013 at the [[Barclays Center]] in [[Brooklyn]], [[New York (state)|New York]].{{cite web|url=http://www.mtv.com/news/articles/1704268/vmas-2013-brooklyn-barclays-center.jhtml|title=MTV VMAs Coming To Brooklyn's Barclays Center! - Music, Celebrity, Artist News |last=Kaufman|first=Gil |date=July 17, 2012 |work=[[MTV]] |publisher=[[Viacom]] |accessdate=July 18, 2013}} Marking the 30th installment of the award show, they were the first to be held in [[New York City]] not to use a venue within the [[Borough (New York City)|borough]] of [[Manhattan]]. Nominations were announced on July 17, 2013. Leading the nominees were [[Justin Timberlake]] and [[Macklemore & Ryan Lewis]] with six, followed by [[Bruno Mars]], [[Miley Cyrus]], and [[Robin Thicke]] with four.{{cite news|url= http://www.dailymail.co.uk/tvshowbiz/article-2402006/Its-strip-Katy-Perry-Lady-Gaga-Miley-Cyrus-perform-smalls-fight-limelight-sexed-MTV-VMAs-2013.html|title= It’s not a strip show! Katy Perry, Lady Gaga and Miley Cyrus perform in their smalls as they fight for the limelight on sexed up MTV VMAs 2013|date=25 August 2013|work= Daily Mail|accessdate=26 August 2013|location=London|first=George|last=Stark}}{{cite news|url= https://www.nytimes.com/2013/08/27/arts/music/mtv-video-music-awards-review.html?hp|title= At Video Music Awards, a Lot to Look Away From|date=26 August 2013|work= New York Times|accessdate=26 August 2013|first=Jon|last=Caramanica}} Justin Timberlake was the big winner on the night with four awards, including [[MTV Video Music Award for Video of the Year|Video of the Year]] for "[[Mirrors (Justin Timberlake song)|Mirrors]]" and the Michael Jackson Vanguard Award.{{cite web|url= http://www.billboard.com/articles/news/5672586/justin-timberlake-lady-gaga-and-macklemore-rock-brooklyn-at-mtv-vmas-2013|title= Justin Timberlake, Lady Gaga and Macklemore Rock Brooklyn at MTV VMAs 2013|date=26 August 2013|work= Billboard.com|accessdate=27 August 2013 }}{{cite news|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/news/mtv-vmas-justin-timberlake-wins-614162|title= Justin Timberlake Wins Top Prize, Macklemore Earns Three Moonmen|date=26 August 2013|work=The Hollywood Reporter|accessdate=27 August 2013|first=Sophie|last=Schillaci}} Macklemore & Ryan Lewis, Bruno Mars and [[Taylor Swift]] were also among the winners of the night.{{cite news|url= https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/people/2013/08/25/vmas-mtv-news/2696959/|title= Justin Timberlake, Lady Gaga sizzle at MTV VMAs|date=26 August 2013|work= USA Today|accessdate=27 August 2013|first1=Cindy|last1=Clark}} The ceremony drew a total of 10.1 million viewers. The show featured [[Miley Cyrus]] and [[Robin Thicke]]'s raunchy and sexually-driven performance for the medley of their songs "[[We Can't Stop]]" and "[[Blurred Lines]]", which received negative reactions from critics and mixed reactions from fans and fellow celebrities. The most watched performance of the night was [[Justin Timberlake]]'s 15-minute medley number, which included a mini-reunion with [[NSYNC]], leading up to his acceptance speech for the [[Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award]]. ==Performances== {| class="wikitable" |- !Artist(s) !Song(s) |- !colspan=2|Pre-show |- |[[Austin Mahone]] |"[[What About Love (Austin Mahone song)|What About Love]]" |- |[[Ariana Grande]] |"[[Baby I]]"
"[[The Way (Ariana Grande song)|The Way]]" |- !colspan=2|Main show |- |[[Lady Gaga]] |"[[Applause (Lady Gaga song)|Applause]]" |- |[[Miley Cyrus]]

|accessdate=2014-01-12}} ===Michael Jackson Video Vanguard Award=== '''[[Justin Timberlake]]''' == Controversy == Pop singer [[Miley Cyrus]] became the subject of widespread media attention following a controversial performance with [[Robin Thicke]]. The performance began with Cyrus performing "[[We Can't Stop]]" in bear-themed attire. Following this, Thicke entered the stage and Cyrus stripped down to a skin-colored two-piece latex outfit while they performed "[[Blurred Lines]]" in a duet. Cyrus subsequently touched Thicke's [[crotch]] area with a giant pedicured foam finger and [[twerking|twerked]] against him. An article published in ''[[The Hollywood Reporter]]'' described the performance as "crass" and "reminiscent of a bad [[acid trip]]".{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/earshot/note-miley-cyrus-please-stop-614407|title=Note to Miley Cyrus: Please Stop; Plus Other VMAs Ruminations|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=August 26, 2013|accessdate=August 26, 2013}} The performance was described by ''[[XXL (magazine)|XXL]]'' critic B. J. Steiner as a "trainwreck in the classic sense of the word as the audience reaction seemed to be a mix of confusion, dismay and horror in a cocktail of embarrassment",{{cite web|title=The Most Awkward Hip-Hop Moments At MTV’s 2013 Video Music Awards|author=Steiner, B. J.|url=http://www.xxlmag.com/news/2013/08/the-most-awkward-hip-hop-moments-at-mtvs-2013-video-music-awards/|work=[[XXL (magazine)|XXL]]|publisher=[[Harris Publications]]|date=August 26, 2013|accessdate=August 26, 2013}} while the BBC said Cyrus stole the show with a "raunchy performance".{{cite web|title=Justin Timberlake wins big at MTV awards, Miley Cyrus steals show|author=|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/entertainment-arts-23839865|publisher=[[BBC News]]. [[BBC]]|date=August 26, 2013|accessdate=August 26, 2013}} Katy Kroll of ''[[Rolling Stone]]'' magazine wrote in 2014, "there were dancing teddy bears, an overused foam finger, an unflattering flesh-colored bikini, some very obvious groping and twerking – lots and lots of twerking. For lack of a better term, it was a hot mess."{{cite web|url=https://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/miley-cyrus-robin-thicke-vma-performance-one-year-later-20140822|archivedate=May 13, 2016|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20160513101122/http://www.rollingstone.com/tv/news/miley-cyrus-robin-thicke-vma-performance-one-year-later-20140822|title=Twerk It Out: Miley and Robin's VMA Performance, One Year Later|author=Kroll, Katy|work=Rolling Stone|date=August 22, 2014|accessdate=January 29, 2015}} A ''[[The Daily Telegraph|Telegraph]]'' article described Cyrus' actions as her going into "overdrive [...] trying to kill off her Disney millstone, ''[[Hannah Montana]]''".{{cite web|url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/women/womens-life/10267842/MTV-Video-Music-Awards-2013-Miley-Cyrus-and-that-performance-the-reasons-why-everybodys-talking-about-it.html|title=MTV Video Music Awards 2013: Why everybody's talking about Miley Cyrus and that performance|last1=Peacock|first1=Louisa|last2=Kerr|first2=Isabelle|work=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|date=August 27, 2013|accessdate=October 9, 2017}} The performance generated 306,100 tweets per minute on Twitter, Cyrus' performance resulted in a gain of over 213,000 [[Twitter]] followers, 226,000 likes on [[Facebook]], and 90,000 downloads of her new single, "[[Wrecking Ball (Miley Cyrus song)|Wrecking Ball]]", within days of the controversial performance. This amounted to a total 112% increase in Cyrus' social media activity.{{cite web|url=http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/125139/Miley-Cyrus-Raunchy-VMAs-Performance-Helps-Star-Gain-213104-Twitter-Followers-And-Sell-90000-Downloads |title=Miley Cyrus' Raunchy VMAs Performance Helps Star Gain 213,104 Twitter Followers And Sell 90,000 Downloads |author=Joanna Crawley |publisher=Entertainmentwise. Gigwise |date=August 31, 2013 |accessdate=September 29, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140924131916/http://www.entertainmentwise.com/news/125139/Miley-Cyrus-Raunchy-VMAs-Performance-Helps-Star-Gain-213104-Twitter-Followers-And-Sell-90000-Downloads |archivedate=September 24, 2014 }} The performance topped Twitter during the East Coast telecast, with Timberlake behind with 219,800 tweets per minute at its peak. The most-mentioned performers on Twitter were Cyrus (4.5 million), Timberlake (2.9 million) and Lady Gaga (1.9 million).{{cite web|url=http://www.hollywoodreporter.com/live-feed/tv-ratings-mtv-vmas-up-614095|title=TV Ratings: MTV VMAs Up 66 Percent Due to Justin Timberlake, 'N Sync Reunion|work=The Hollywood Reporter|date=August 26, 2013|accessdate=August 26, 2013}} ==See also== *[[2013 MTV Europe Music Awards]] ==References== {{reflist|3}} ==External links== * {{official website|http://www.mtv.com/ontv/vma/}} {{MTV Video Music Awards}} {{DEFAULTSORT:2013 MTV Video Music Awards}} [[Category:2013 controversies]] [[Category:2013 in American music|MTV Video Music Awards]] [[Category:2013 in New York City|MTV Video Music Awards]] [[Category:2013 music awards|MTV Video Music Awards]] [[Category:Media-related controversies in the United States]] [[Category:MTV Video Music Awards|2013]] [[Category:Television controversies in the United States]] [[Category:2013 awards in the United States|MTV Video Music]]

{{Infobox company | name = 360networks, Inc. | industry = [[Telecommunications]] | fate = Acquired by [[Zayo Group]] | founded = {{start date and age|1998|02|05}} | founder = Jerry Tharp
David Lede
Clifford Lede | defunct = {{start date and age|2011|12|01}} | location = [[Seattle, Washington]] }} '''360networks, Inc.''' was a wholesale telecommunications carrier. The company developed many long-haul fiber optic routes, primarily along railroad rights of way, consisting of both [[dark fiber]] and lit fiber. These long-haul routes included Chicago to New Orleans, Chicago to Denver, Chicago to Detroit, Chicago to New York, Seattle to Los Angeles, and Denver to San Francisco. In 2011, the company was acquired by [[Zayo Group]]. ==History== The company was founded as Pacific Fiber Link, L.L.C. on February 5, 1998 as a subsidiary of Ledcor Industries of Canada, a member of the [[Ledcor Group of Companies]], owned by the Lede family. It commenced business operations on May 31, 1998. As the fiber optic telecommunications industry boomed, one of the greatest impediments to rapid growth for the telecoms was the acquisition of the rights of way within which to lay the fiber optic cables. The Ledes came up with a solution to this problem and negotiated a deal with the [[Canadian National Railway]] to install the cable in the railroad's rights of way alongside the tracks. The company made significant contributions to the linear construction industry by inventing and patenting the Railplow, that is mounted on a flatbed railcar and used to rapidly excavate a trench alongside railroad tracks, install conduits used for housing fiber optic cables, then backfilling the trench and completing the construction and installation process within a very short span of time. This technology enabled 360networks to rapidly lay out a North American fiber optic network throughout Canada and the United States along and within numerous railroad rights of way. The patent for the Railplow was transferred to a subsidiary of the two companies and 360networks received a royalty-free, exclusive license for the use of the Railplow, giving it a significant advantage over some of its competitors that also utilized rail corridors.{{cite web | url=https://www.sec.gov/Archives/edgar/data/1084587/000091205700018688/0000912057-00-018688.txt | title=360 Networks Form F-1 | publisher=[[U.S. Securities and Exchange Commission]] | date=April 18, 2000}} Initially, the company focused on building a fiber optic route from Seattle to Sacramento. In 1999, it changed its name to Worldwide Fiber Networks, Inc. and its focus toward a global network. Not long thereafter, the company again changed its name to 360networks (USA), Inc., to better describe its 360-degree focus on a global network. [[Greg Maffei]], the former [[chief financial officer]] of [[Microsoft]], was hired as the [[chief executive officer]] of the company.{{cite news | url=http://archive.fortune.com/magazines/fortune/fortune_archive/2000/11/13/291579/index.htm | title=Still Afloat In An Ocean Of Doubt | first=Stephanie N. | last=Mehta | work=[[Fortune (magazine)|Fortune]] | date=November 13, 2000}} The company received investments from [[Michael Dell]], [[Nathan Myhrvold]], [[Liberty Media]], and [[News Corp.]] In April 2000, during the [[dot-com bubble]], the company became a [[public company]] via an [[initial public offering]], raising C$2.4 billion (US$1.45 billion) and giving the company a [[market capitalization]] of C$20.6 billion.{{cite news | url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/360networks-ipo-a-success/article25460416/ | title=360networks' IPO a success | first1=PETER | last1=KENNEDY | first2=LAWRENCE | last2=SURTEES | work=[[The Globe and Mail]] | date=April 21, 2000}}{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB956245006431825853 | title=360networks Raises $1.45 Billion In Its Offering, but Disappoints | first=Jim | last=Carlton | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=November 13, 2000}}{{subscription required}}{{cite news | url=http://money.cnn.com/2000/04/20/technology/360networks/ | title=360networks in tepid debut | work=[[CNNMoney]] | date=April 20, 2000}} In May 2000, the company acquired 1 million square feet of space to house computer networking equipment in Los Angeles, Atlanta and Dallas for $144 million in cash and stock.{{cite news | url=https://www.nytimes.com/2000/05/16/business/360networks-in-expansion.html | title=360networks in Expansion | agency=[[Dow Jones & Company]] | publisher=[[The New York Times]] | date=May 16, 2000}}{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB958442820151605154 | title=360networks Acquires Co-Location Facilities | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=May 16, 2000}}{{subscription required}} In August 2000, the company acquired 11,000 miles of fiber optic infrastructure from [[Call-Net Enterprises Incorporated]] for $162.5 million.{{cite news | url=https://www.marketwatch.com/story/360networks-acquires-call-net-fiber-optic-lines | title=360Networks acquires Call-Net fiber | first=Carl | last=Corry | work=[[Marketwatch]] | date=August 28, 2000}} In November 2000, the company had a market capitalization of $13 billion, despite only $234 million in revenue for the first six months of 2000. In May 2001, the company received a license to own infrastructure in Japan.{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/memphis/stories/2001/05/28/daily17.html | title=360networks lands Japan license | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=May 30, 2001}} In early June 2001, the company skipped a debt payment.{{cite news | url=https://www.forbes.com/2001/06/18/0618telcodebt.html | title=Telecom Debt Bombs Exploding | first=Mark | last=Lewis | work=[[Forbes]] | date=June 18, 2001}} On June 28, 2001, the company filed [[bankruptcy]] in Canada and the United States.{{cite news | url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/360networks-files-for-bankruptcy-protection/article25706475/ | title=360networks files for bankruptcy protection | work=[[The Globe and Mail]] | date=June 28, 2001}}{{cite news | url=http://articles.latimes.com/2001/jun/29/business/fi-16430 | title=360Networks Seeks Bankruptcy Protection in U.S., Canada | agency=[[Reuters]] | publisher=[[Los Angeles Times]] | date=June 29, 2001}}{{cite news | url=https://www.marketwatch.com/story/360networks-files-for-chapter-11 | title=360networks files for Chapter 11 | first=Nicole | last=Maestri | work=[[Marketwatch]] | date=June 28, 2001}} In October 2002, [[WL Ross & Co]] acquired 12.5% of the company.{{cite news | url=https://www.wsj.com/articles/SB1033511621878956433 | title=360networks to Announce Backing From W.L. Ross | first=Deborah | last1=Solomon | first2=Kara | last2=Scannell | first3=Mark | last3=Heinzl | work=[[The Wall Street Journal]] | date=October 2, 2002}}{{subscription required}} In November 2002, the company emerged from bankruptcy.{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/stories/2002/11/11/daily18.html | title=360networks emerges from bankruptcy | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=November 12, 2002}} The company also acquired Group Telecom.{{cite news | url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/360networks-to-buy-group-telecom/article25697669/ | title=360networks to buy Group Telecom | first=TERRY | last=WEBER | work=[[The Globe and Mail]] | date=November 18, 2002}} In May 2003, the company acquired the U.S. communications business of [[Dynegy]].{{cite press release | url=https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20030515005292/en/Dynegy-Completes-Sale-U.S.-Communications-Business-360networks | title=Dynegy Completes Sale of U.S. Communications Business To 360networks | publisher=[[Business Wire]] | date=May 15, 2003}} In November 2003, the company sold assets to [[Qwest]].{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/portland/stories/2003/11/17/daily9.html | title=Qwest buys Touch America, 360 Networks assets | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=November 17, 2003}} In January 2004, the company bought the assets of Touch America out of bankruptcy.{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/stories/2004/01/12/daily10.html | title=360networks buys assets from Touch America | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=January 13, 2004}} In May 2004, the company sold its Canadian assets to [[Bell Canada]] for C$275 million.{{cite press release | url=http://www.bce.ca/news-and-media/releases/show/bell-canada-buys-canadian-assets-of-360networks | title=Bell Canada buys Canadian assets of 360networks | publisher=[[Bell Canada]] | date=May 26, 2004}}{{cite news | url=https://www.theglobeandmail.com/report-on-business/bell-buys-360networks-assets/article1132970/ | title=Bell buys 360networks assets | first1=PETER | last1=KENNEDY | first2=DAVE | last2=EBNER | work=[[The Globe and Mail]] | date=May 27, 2004}} In July 2005, Greg Maffei vacated his position as CEO to work for [[Oracle Corporation]], but remained chairman.{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/seattle/stories/2005/07/18/story8.html | title=Even without Maffei, 360 hungrily hunts deals | first=Jeff | last=Meisner | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=July 17, 2005}} In December 2011, the company was acquired by [[Zayo Group]].{{cite press release | url=https://www.zayo.com/news/zayo-acquires-360networks-2/ | title=ZAYO ACQUIRES 360NETWORKS | publisher=[[Zayo Group]] | date=December 2, 2011}}{{cite news | url=https://www.bizjournals.com/denver/news/2011/12/02/zayo-group-completes-360networks-buy.html | title=Zayo Group completes 360networks buy | first=Greg | last=Avery | work=[[American City Business Journals]] | date=December 2, 2011}} ==References== {{Reflist|1}} [[Category:1998 establishments in Canada]] [[Category:Defunct telecommunications companies of Canada]] [[Category:Defunct telecommunications companies of the United States]] [[Category:Dot-com bubble]]

revision.text:
[https://www.alabamatogether.org/ Alabama Together] is a grassroots community organization in East Alabama that supports progressive issues and political candidates at local, state and national levels.{{Cite web|url=http://www.alabamatogether.org/about.html|title=Alabama Together|website=www.alabamatogether.org|access-date=2018-08-18}} Alabama Together was founded in December 2016;{{Cite news|url=http://www.theplainsman.com:8080/article/2017/04/alabama-together-a-refined-pantsuit-nation|title=Alabama Together: A refined Pantsuit Nation|last=Jackson|first=Lily|date=April 10, 2017|work=The Auburn Plainsman|access-date=2018-08-18}} it is headquartered in [[Auburn, Alabama]]. Alabama Together's work and events have received national press coverage in the ''[[The New York Times|New York Times]]''{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2018/06/02/opinion/sunday/southern-states-politics-midterms.html|title=No One Really Understands the South|last=Okeowo|first=Alexis|date=June 2, 2018|work=|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} and ''[[USA Today]].''{{Cite news|url=https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/2017/04/22/march-science-aims-counter-alarming-anti-science-trends/100780684/|title=Marchers for Science protest 'alarming' anti-science trends|last=|first=|date=April 22, 2017|work=USA TODAY|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} == Background == Alabama Together was founded shortly after the [[2016 presidential election in the united states|2016 presidential election]]. The organization, which grew out of a private [[Pantsuit Nation]] Facebook group, held its first official meeting in December 2016; the meeting attracted over 100 attendees.{{Cite news|url=https://www.auburnvillager.com/news/alabama-together-works-to-give-residents-a-voice/article_05842292-25d6-11e7-9ac9-ef188eafa395.html|title=Alabama Together works to give residents a voice|last=Blankenship|first=Allison|date=April 20, 2017|work=The Auburn Villager|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} Alabama Together identifies as part of [[Protests against Donald Trump|The Resistance]].{{Cite web|url=http://www.alabamatogether.org/community/community.html|title=AL Together Community|website=www.alabamatogether.org|access-date=2018-08-18}} According to its mission statement,
We are Alabama Together, a concerned group of Alabama residents and voters who support democracy, transparent governance, and an inclusive society that honors all people. We support equality, economic justice, and human rights. We believe in accessible healthcare, quality public education, diplomacy, diversity, a pristine natural environment, separation of church and state, sensible gun policy, a fair immigration system, and an electoral process that is free from interference. We value public policies that are socially, economically, and environmentally sustainable. We are patriotic, informed, multigenerational, intersectional, undeterred Alabamians, and We are the Future.{{Cite web|url=https://www.alabamatogether.org/|title=Alabama Together|website=www.alabamatogether.org|access-date=2018-08-18}}
Alabama Together has applauded the work of [[Moms Demand Action]], the [http://www.lwv-eastalabama.org/ League of Women Voters of East Alabama], Gain, the Auburn-Opelika SURJ Chapter, [[PFLAG]], the [http://www.lcdcalabama.com/ Lee County Democratic Club], the [[Alabama College Democrats]], the [https://arisecitizens.org/ Arise Citizen's Policy Project], the [[Southern Poverty Law Center]], the [[Equal Justice Initiative]], the [[2017 Women's March|Women's March on Washington]], and the [[American Civil Liberties Union|ACLU]]. == Community Engagement == === Support for local candidates === In 2018, Alabama Together helped support about "a dozen women running for office for the first time, part of a surge of new Democratic candidates in the state challenging long-serving Republican incumbents." It also held events supporting [[Doug Jones (politician)|Doug Jones']] successful campaign for United States Senator.{{Cite web|url=https://www.facebook.com/events/363478710768899/|title=Justice Event for Doug Jones Supporters|website=www.facebook.com|language=en|access-date=2018-08-18}} Alabama Together members Laura Mirachi and Bob Parsons are currently campaigning for seats on [[City of Auburn|Auburn City Council]].{{Cite news|url=https://www.auburnvillager.com/news/laura-mirarchi-seeks-ward-council-seat/article_a1ec9ff2-90dc-11e8-a4ff-3b5242a14c50.html|title=Laura Mirarchi seeks Ward 7 council seat|last=Blankenship|first=Allison|date=July 26, 2018|work=The Auburn Villager|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=https://www.oanow.com/townnews/politics/updated-complete-list-of-candidates-running-in-city-of-auburn/article_a0062e6e-8b9c-11e8-9e2e-db727d718335.html|title=Complete list of candidates running in city of Auburn municipal election|last=Nelson|first=Carla|date=July 19, 2018|work=Opelika-Auburn News|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} === Civic forums === Alabama Together holds civic forums for officeholders and candidates for local, state, and national elective office. On August 16th, 2018, Alabama Together hosted a Civic Forum to give voters the opportunity to learn about candidates for state office and candidates for Alabama's 3rd congressional district.{{Cite news|url=https://www.oanow.com/news/alabama-together-to-host-forum-thursday/article_9b02f096-a041-11e8-b4e1-effed7cbfc47.html|title=Alabama Together to host forum Thursday|last=Nelson|first=Carla|date=August 15, 2018|work=OANow.com|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} Democratic candidate for Congress, [[Mallory Hagan]], spoke at the event; incumbent Congressman [[Mike Rogers (Alabama politician)|Mike Rogers]] (R) refused to attend, citing unspecified scheduling conflicts.{{Cite news|url=https://www.auburnvillager.com/opinion/letters-to-the-editor-open-letter-to-mike-rogers-camp/article_918786c2-9b40-11e8-b158-a3d0de5856be.html|title=Letters to the editor: Open letter to Mike Rogers|last=Brodbeck|first=Shanna|date=August 8, 2018|work=The Auburn Villager|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} {{Cite web|url=http://opelikaobserver.com/alabama-together-to-host-candidate-forum-for-al-house-district-3/|title=Alabama Together to host candidate forum for AL House District 3|last=|first=|date=August 15, 2018|website=opelikaobserver.com|language=en-US|archive-url=|archive-date=|dead-url=|access-date=2018-08-18}} In addition to congressional candidate [[Mallory Hagan]], participating candidates included Nancy Carlton Bendinger (D), a candidate for [[Alabama Senate District 27]]; Mary Wynne Kling (D), a candidate for [[Alabama House District 79]]; Joe Lovvorn, a candidate for [[Alabama House District 79]] (R-incumbent); Jeremy Gray (D), a candidate for [[Alabama House District 83]]; and Michael Holden (R), a candidate for [[Alabama House District 83]]. In April 2017, Alabama Together also organized a civic forum and invited Congressman [[Mike Rogers (Alabama politician)|Mike Rogers]] (R). At the time, Representative Rogers had not held a public forum in [[Lee County, Alabama|Lee County]] in over two years, even though it is home to approximately 140,000 of his constituents and to [[Auburn University]]. Alabama Together spent months repeatedly reaching out to Representative Rogers, sending emails, writing letters, making calls, and leaving messages with his local and D.C. offices.{{Cite news|url=https://www.annistonstar.com/columnists/phillip_tutor/phillip-tutor-want-to-talk-to-rep-rogers-good-luck/article_ca495126-2ba1-11e7-9eb1-477fb8ca5af7.html|title=Want to talk to Rep. Rogers? Good luck|last=Tutor|first=Phillip|date=April 27, 2017|work=The Anniston Star|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}}{{Cite news|url=http://www.theplainsman.com/article/2017/04/u-s-rep-mike-rogers-constituents-hold-their-own-town-hall|title=U.S. Rep Mike Rogers' constituents hold their own 'town hall'|last=Willoughby|first=Sam|date=April 18, 2017|work=The Auburn Plainsman|access-date=2018-08-18}} Alabama Together offered five meeting-date options during the congressional recess and offered to send the questions ahead of time, but Representative Rogers refused to acknowledge the invitation. The forum continued in his absence, and residents and voters addressed a video camera with their concerns about Representative Rogers' failure to represent the interests of his constituents.{{Cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCDWgz3YCxKXKbV9fGstbeLw|title=Alabama Together|website=YouTube|language=en|access-date=2018-08-18}} Representative Rogers refused to participate in a similar event in [[Montgomery, Alabama|Montgomery]] in February 2017. === Marches and other community events === Alabama Together helps organize political marches, including a [[March for Science]], in Auburn, Alabama in April 2017. {{Cite news|url=http://www.theplainsman.com/article/2017/04/march-for-science-sweeps-downtown-auburn|title=March for Science sweeps downtown Auburn|work=The Auburn Plainsman|access-date=2018-08-18}} Alabama Together also participated in [https://www.prideontheplains.com/ Pride on the Plains], the first municipal pride events ever held in Auburn and Opelika, Alabama; Pride on the Plains was covered in the [[The New York Times|''New York Times'']].{{Cite news|url=https://www.nytimes.com/interactive/2018/06/29/us/alabama-lgbt-gay-communities-organizations.html|title=Love and Pride in Alabama: A Photo Album|last=Lieberman|first=Rebecca|date=June 29, 2018|work=The New York Times|access-date=2018-08-18|language=en}} == References == [[Category:2016 establishments in Alabama]] [[Category:Organizations established in 2016]] [[Category:2017 in American politics]] [[Category:21st-century social movements]] [[Category:Aftermath of the United States presidential election, 2016]] [[Category:Progressivism in the United States]] [[Category:Alabama-related lists]] [[Category:Auburn, Alabama]] __FORCETOC__ __INDEX__ [[Category:Lee County, Alabama]]

revision.text:
{{Infobox wrestling event |name = Arena Coliseo 70th Anniversary Show |image =ArenaColiseo70An.jpeg |alt = |caption =Official poster for the event promoting the main event and special appearance of [[Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.]] and [[Universo 2000]] |promotion = [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] |date = April 7, 2013<ref name=Live>{{cite web|url=http://deportes.terra.com.mx/otros-deportes/la-funcion-del-70-aniversario-de-la-arena-coliseo-por-terra,c7d8df38363cd310VgnVCM20000099cceb0aRCRD.html|title=La function del 70 aniversario de la Arena Coliseo por terra|date=April 2, 2013|accessdate=April 23, 2013|work=Terra|language=Spanish}}</ref> |attendance = |liveevent=y |venue = [[Arena Coliseo]] |city = [[Mexico City|Mexico City, Mexico]] |lastevent = ''[[List of CMLL tag team tournaments#Torneo Increibles de Parejas, Arena Puebla 2013|Torneo Increibles de Parejas, Arena Puebla]]'' |nextevent = ''[[Gran Alternativa 2013|Torneo Gran Alternativa]]'' (2013) }} On April 7, 2013, CMLL celebrated the '''Arena Coliseo's 70th Anniversary Show''' with a special [[professional wrestling]] event that featured a number of veteran wrestlers that did not usually work for CMLL such as [[Negro Navarro]], [[Black Terry]], [[Villano IV]], [[Villano V|Ray Mendoza, Jr.]], [[Universo 2000]], [[Máscara Año 2000]], and [[Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.]] working with a number of CMLL wrestlers. The main event of the show saw [[Dragón Rojo, Jr.]] defend the [[CMLL World Middleweight Championship]] against [[NWA World Historic Welterweight Championship|NWA World Historic Welterweight Champion]] [[La Sombra (wrestler)|La Sombra]]. The event commemorated the completion of [[Arena Coliseo]] on April 2, 1943, built by CMLL owner and founder [[Salvador Lutteroth]]. The show aired live on the Mexican television channel Terra.<ref name=Live/>
==Background== The event featured six [[professional wrestling matches]], in which some wrestlers are involved in pre-existing [[script (recorded media)|scripted]] [[Feud (professional wrestling)|feuds]] or [[narrative thread|storylines]] and others are teamed up with no particular backstory leading up to the match. Wrestlers themselves portray either [[Heel (professional wrestling)|villains]] (referred to as "''Rudos''" in Mexico) or [[Face (professional wrestling)|fan favorites]] ("''Tecnicos''" in Mexico) as they compete in matches with pre-determined outcomes.
[[professional wrestling promotion|professional wrestling promoter]] [[Salvador Lutteroth]] began promoting wrestling, or ''Lucha libre'' events in [[Arena México|Arena Modelo]] in 1933 as he founded [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre|Empresa Mexicana de Lucha Libre]] (EMLL).<ref name=Lutteroth>{{cite book|title=Lucha Libre: Masked Superstars of Mexican Wrestling|publisher=Distributed Art Publishers, Inc.|year=2005|chapter=Los Lutteroth / the Lutteroth|pages=20–27|isbn=968-6842-48-9}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/misccards.html|title=EMLL Debut show|date=September 21, 1933|accessdate=January 25, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> The building served as the main venue for Lutteroth's promotion from 1933 until the early 1940s when the success of ''Lucha Libre'' meant that Arena Model was becoming too small to accommodate the weekly shows. Lutteroth financed the building of a new arena with $40,000 that he had won in the national lottery. The building would sit on the location of ''República de Perú'' 77 in the [[Cuauhtémoc, D.F.|Cuauhtémoc]] and was designed by Architect Francisco Bullman. Upon its completion in 1943 it was the first sports building in Mexico to have built in Air Conditioning. The building would hold 8,863 spectators for wrestling or boxing events and quickly gained the nickname the "Lagunilla Funnel" due to the design of the spectators stands in regards to the ring in the middle. The venue began hosting Boxing events only a few months after opening and for years would run both wrestling and boxing events throughout the year.<ref name="Lutteroth"/> The venue served as the main building for EMLL, hosting their [[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre Anniversary Shows|Anniversary shows]] starting with their [[EMLL 10th Anniversary Show|10th Anniversary show]] in 1943 through their [[EMLL 22nd Anniversary Show|22nd Anniversary show]] in 1955. From 1956 and forward Arena Coliseo became a secondary venue for EMLL, with the newly constructed [[Arena México]] taking over as the venue for all of EMLL's major shows. In 1979, for unknown reasons EMLL held their [[EMLL 46th Anniversary Show|46th Anniversary Show]] in Arena Coliseo instead of Arena México, marking the last major EMLL event held there.<ref name=EMLL46>{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/anniversary50.html#46|title=46th Anniversary Show|date=August 21, 1979|accessdate=September 27, 2012|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> In the weeks leading up to the 70th anniversary of Arena Coliseo CMLL began promoting the history of the arena, detailing its rich history of both boxing and wrestling as well as its role in Women's wrestling in Mexico, the championship matches that had taken place in the arena over the years and the large number of ''[[Luchas de Apuestas]]'' matches that had taken place on the premises and finally the deaths of boxers and wrestlers in the actual arena.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://cmllgaceta.wordpress.com/2013/03/25/arena-coliseo-la-genuina-casa-del-boxeo-sus-triunfos-sus-muertes/|title=Arena Coliseo, La Genuina casa del Boxeo -Sus triunfos – sus muertes|date=March 25, 2013|accessdate=April 23, 2013|publisher=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] Gaceta|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://cmllgaceta.wordpress.com/2013/03/29/arena-coliseo-el-templo-de-la-lucha-femenil/|title=Arena Coliseo el templo de la Lucha feminil|date=March 29, 2013|accessdate=April 23, 2013|publisher=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]] Gaceta|language=Spanish}}</ref><ref name=ColiseoApuesta>{{cite web|url=http://www.mediotiempo.com/mas-deportes/lucha-libre/noticias/2013/04/03/arena-coliseo-cementerio-de-mascaras-y-cabelleras|title=Arena Coliseo, cementerio de máscaras y cabelleras|date=April 3, 2013|accessdate=April 5, 2013|publisher=[[MSN]]|work=Medio Tiempo|language=Spanish}}</ref>
The main event of the show would see reigning [[CMLL World Middleweight Championship|CMLL World Middleweight Champion]] [[Dragón Rojo, Jr.]] defend his championship against challenger [[La Sombra (wrestler)|La Sombra]] in a [[Professional wrestling match types#Series variations|Best two-out-of three falls match]]. The two wrestlers had faced off multiple times in the past, most recently on January 20, 2013 during a CMLL/[[New Japan Pro Wrestling]] co-promoted show in Japan called [[Fantastica Mania 2013#Fantastica Mania January 20, 2013|''Fantastica Mania'' 2013]]. During the show La Sombra won the [[NWA World Historic Welterweight Championship]] from Dragón Rojo, Jr.<ref name=FantasticaMania2013N3>{{cite web|url=http://www.njpw.co.jp/match/detail_result.php?e=682|title=NJPW Presents CMLL Fantastica Mania 2013|accessdate=January 20, 2013|publisher=[[New Japan Pro Wrestling]]|language=Japanese}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.net/2013/01/20/la-sombra-nuevo-campeon-mundial-historico-nwa-de-peso-medio/|title=La Sombra... ¡nuevo Campeón Mundial Histórico NWA de Peso Medio!|last=Mexicool|first=Rey|date=January 20, 2013|accessdate=January 20, 2013|work=SuperLuchas|language=Spanish}}</ref>
The fourth and fifth match of the show featured matches contested under [[Professional wrestling tag team match types#Trios rules (Relevos Australianos)|best two-out-of-three falls six-man tag team]] rules and in each case featured one team representing CMLL and one team representing ''Los Independientes'', or the [[Independent circuit]] that were not under contract with CMLL. [[Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.]] had worked CMLL's 2013 ''[[Homenaje a Dos Leyendas (2013)|Homenaje a Dos Leyendas]]'' only a few weeks earlier, against [[Universo 2000]] and the two independent, "old school" wrestlers found themselves on opposite sides once again. Rayo teamed up with CMLL regulars [[Atlantis (wrestler)|Atlantis]] and [[Diamante Azul]] while Universo 2000 teamed up with his brother [[Máscara Año 2000]] and [[Villano V|Ray Mendoza, Jr.]] On February 21, 2013, CMLL held a press conference to officially announce that the ''Homenaje a Dos Leyendas'' would pay tribute to [[Rayo de Jalisco, Sr.|Rayo de Jalisco]] ("The Lighting from [[Jalisco]]") and brought out Rayo's son, [[Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.]], as part of the announcement. Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. had not worked for CMLL since 2010 but made a special appearance due to the company honoring his father. During the press conference Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.'s long time rival [[Universo 2000]] interrupted Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. and the two ended up challenging each other to a match that would take place at the 2013 ''Homenaje a Dos Leyendas'', although the exact nature of the match was not announced at the time. The rivalry between the two wrestlers hailed back to at least 1997 where Universo 2000 defeated both [[Cien Caras]] and Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. to win the [[CMLL World Heavyweight Championship]].<ref name=CMLLHeavy12>{{cite book |author=Royal Duncan and Gary Will|title=Wrestling Title Histories|publisher=Archeus Communications|chapter=Mexico: EMLL CMLL Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre heavyweight Title|page=395|year=2000|isbn=0-9698161-5-4}}</ref><ref name=LaRazaMarch132009>{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/news2009/1236925821.php|title=Viva La Raza! Lucha Weekly|author=Boutwell, Josh|date=March 13, 2009|accessdate=February 26, 2010|publisher=WrestleView}}</ref> After being masked since his debut in 1985 Universo 2000 lost a ''Lucha de Apuesta'' match to [[Canek (wrestler)|El Canek]] in the main event of the [[CMLL 71st Anniversary Show|71st Anniversary Show]], on September 17, 2004, the match also included Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. and Dr. Wagner, Jr. and originally came about due to the Universo 2000/Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. rivalry.<ref name="TomoUniverso">{{cite news|title=Enciclopedia de las Mascaras|work=Universo 2000|location=[[Mexico City]], Mexico|id=Tomo V|pages=21|date=November 2007|language=Spanish}}</ref> Following his unmasking Universo 2000 won the 2004 ''[[Leyenda de Azul#Leyenda de Azul 2004|Leyenda de Azul]]'' (Blue legend tournament).<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.prowrestlinghistory.com/supercards/mexico/emll/blue.html#2004|title=Leyenda de Azul 2004|date=October 8, 2004|accessdate=March 24, 2010|publisher=Pro Wrestling History}}</ref> In subsequent years both Universo 2000 and Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. left CMLL. In 2005 Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. suffered another serious injury, he injured both his knees in a match against Universo 2000's brother [[Máscara Año 2000]], where his legs got caught on the ropes as he jumped out of the ring and he tore ligaments in both knees. The injury kept him out of the ring for almost half a year but in the end Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. was able to make a full recovery and return to the ring.<ref name="FigurasRayoJr">{{cite news|title=Grandes Figuras de la Lucha Libre|work=Rayo de Jalisco, Jr.|location=Portales, Mexico|id=17|page=48|date=November 2008|language = Spanish}}</ref> The incident was used by several promoters as well as Rayo de Jalisco, Jr. himself to create more interest in matches between himself and Universo 2000, Cien Caras and Máscara Año 2000.At the ''Homenaje a Dos Leyendas'' show Rayo de Jalisco, Jr., [[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]], and [[Rush (wrestler)|Rush]] defeated the team of Universo 2000, [[Mr. Niebla]] and [[El Terrible]] by disqualification when Universo 2000 cheated.<ref name=Yahoo2Leyendas13>{{cite web|url=http://mx.deportes.yahoo.com/fotos/lucha-libre-función-15-de-marzo-de-2013-slideshow/|title=Lucha Libre: Función 15 de marzo de 2013|date=March 15, 2013|accessdate=March 16, 2013|first=Gonzalo|last=López|publisher=[[Yahoo!]]|language=Spanish}}</ref> Ray Mendoza, Jr.'s appearance at the show was the subject of some controversy as he had held an official [[Villano V#Supposed retirement|Retirement show]] a few weeks before, only to show up at the special CMLL event. He later explained that his poorly attended retirement show had ended up costing him $38,000 of his own money and thus felt he was forced to work this match to make some of the money back that he had lost.<ref name=RazaColiseo70>{{cite web|url=http://www.wrestleview.com/featured-articles/40946-feature-viva-la-raza-lucha-weekly-for-4-13-13|title=Viva la Raza!: Lucha Weekly|date=April 13, 2013|first=Josh|last=Boutwell|publisher=WrestleView}}</ref>
The fourth match of the night would feature CMLL wrestlers [[Averno (wrestler)|Averno]], [[Blue Panther]], and [[Shocker (wrestler)|Shocker]] team up to take on the "Old-school" team of [[Black Terry]], [[Negro Navarro]], and [[Villano IV]]. This match did not have a particular backstory, instead it paired up some CMLL wrestlers who were said to be working the classical mat style wrestling, especially Blue Panther, with three independent circuit workers who worked the same style of wrestling. The third match of the night was an all-female ''[[torneo cibernetico]]'' elimination match where the last women in the ring would be awarded the ''Trofeo Arena Coliseo 70 Aniversario'' cup. The match had the ''tecnica'' team of [[Marcela (wrestler)|Marcela]], [[Estrellita (wrestler)|Estrellita]], [[Goya Kong]], [[Dalys La Caribeña]] and [[Silueta (wrestler)|Silueta]] take on the ''ruda'' team of [[La Amapola]], [[Princesa Sugey]], [[Princesa Blanca]], [[Zeuxis (wrestler)|Zeuxis]], [[Tiffany (luchadora)|Tiffany]]. Estrellita and La Amapola had been on opposite sides of a long running feud that led to a ''Lucha de Apuestas'' match between the two at the 2013 ''Homenaje a Dos Leyendas'' show two weeks prior. The match was won by Estrellita and La Amapola was forced to have all her hair shaved off after the match. The Arena Coliseo 70th Anniversary Show marked the first time the two faced off since the ''Apuestas'' match. The second match of the night centered on the rivalry between [[Metálico]] and [[El Hijo del Signo]] as they were on opposite sides of a six-man tag team match. Metálico teamed up with fellow ''tecnicos''[[Hombre Bala, Jr.]] and [[Super Halcón, Jr.]] while Hijo del Signo partnered up with [[Nosferatu (wrestler)|Nosferatu]] and [[Taurus (wrestler)|Taurus]] for the match. El Hijo del Signo had begun targeting the masked Metálico in the week prior to the show, playing up the brash, arrogant rookie character that he portrayed, stating that Metálico was simply too old and useless. During their matches against each other Hijo del Signo would often go out of his way to attack Metálico, often tearing Metálico's mask apart or using other underhanded tactics to win. The opening match was announced as rookie ''tecnicos'' [[Oro, Jr.]] and [[Soberano, Jr.]] would take on [[Espanto, Jr. (CMLL)|Espanto, Jr.]] and [[Guerrero Negro, Jr.]], with all four wrestlers being part of the ''Generacion'' 2012 class of wrestlers to graduate from the CMLL wrestling school.<ref name=Generacion2012>{{cite web|url=http://superluchas.net/2012/08/27/conferencia-de-prensa-79-aniversario-del-cmll/|title=Confecencia de prensa 79 aniversario del CMLL|date=August 27, 2012|accessdate=November 7, 2012|work=SuperLuchas|language=Spanish}}</ref>
==Event== During the show CMLL officials gave an award to one of the fans in attendance as he had also attended the first Arena Coliseo show 70 years prior. Oro, Jr. was originally announced for the opening match, but was replaced by [[Metatrón (wrestler)|Metatrón]] later on without any explanation given. Metatrón and Soberano, Jr. defeated Espanto, Jr. and Guerrero Negro, Jr. two falls to one.<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> During the second match of the night the storyline between Hijo del Signo and Metálico took center stage as most of the action centered on the two. In the second fall Hijo del Signo pulled Metálico's mask off,<ref>{{cite web|url=http://1.bp.blogspot.com/-a_a_3nNhiTw/UWPQ3OrD3AI/AAAAAAAAwuw/EWt2B0CErAQ/s320/4.JPG|title=image: Hijo del Signo unmasking Metálico|date=April 7, 2013|accessdate=April 23, 2013|publisher=[[Consejo Mundial de Lucha Libre]]|first=Alexis A.|last=Salazar López|language=Spanish}}</ref> hoping to use the distraction to gain a pinfall, but instead he was disqualified when the referee saw the blatant rulebreaking by El Hijo del Signo.<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/>
;''Trofeo Arena Coliseo 70 Aniversario'' order of elimination {| class="wikitable sortable" !'''No.''' !'''Eliminated''' !'''By''' |- |1 || Silueta || Zeuxis<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |2 || Princesa Sugey || Estrellita<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |3 || Zeuxis || Dalys La Caribeña<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |4 || Dalys La Caribeña || Tiffany<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |5 || Estrellita || La Amapola<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |6 || Tiffany || Marcela<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |7 || Marcela || Princesa Blanca<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |8 || La Amapola || Goya Kong<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |9 || Princesa Blanca || Goya Kong<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |- |10 || style="background: #ffdead;"|'''Winner''' || Goya Kong<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> |}
The independent wrestlers were well received by the Arena Coliseo crowd, cheering especially for the portions of the match where Blue Panther and Negro Navarro wrestled against each other. The match ended when Averno forced Black Terry to submit and Blue Panther forced Villano IV to submit to win the third fall. Afterwards the fans showed their appreciation of the match by throwing money into the ring, causing both Panther and Navarro to actually go into the seats to collect more money after the match. Both Panther and Navarro teased that they were going to continue to fight, which drew a favorable response from the crowd.<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> Before the fifth match of the night Ray Mendoza, Jr. took the microphone and announced to the crowd that this would actually be his last match as a professional wrestler. Rayo de Jalisco and his team won both the second and third fall to win the entire match.<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/> In the main event the challenger La Sombra and the champion Dragón Rojo, Jr. quickly split the first two falls between them, tied up at 1–1. The third fall was longer than both the previous falls combined and finally saw Dragón Rojo, Jr. successfully defend the championship when he forced La Sombra to submit.<ref name=70thShow/><ref name=Official70Years/>

{{Use dmy dates|date=January 2011}} {{Infobox music festival | | music_festival_name = Australia Day Live | image = | location = [[Parliament House, Canberra|Parliament House]], [[Canberra]] and [[Sydney]], [[Australia]] | years_active= 2004 - 2016 | dates = 25 January Australia Day Eve | genre = [[Pop music|Pop]] and [[rock music]] | website = [http://www.australiaday.org.au/ Official website] | coordinates = }} '''Australia Day Live''' was a [[concert]] on Federation Mall, the lawns of [[Parliament House, Canberra|Parliament House]] in [[Canberra]], [[Australia]], that was hosted each year on 25 January. The concert, first launched in 2004, featured music from [[Music of Australia|Australian]] artists and musicians. Australia Day Live was preceded by the [[Australian of the Year]] Awards. The name of the concert was changed in 2012 to 'Australia Celebrates Live'.<ref>http://www.abc.net.au/australiaday/bios.htm</ref>
== Australia Celebrates Live concert == '''Australia Celebrates Live''' was a free concert held on the lawns of Parliament House in Canberra every Australia Day eve (25 January). It featured a line-up of Australian acts.
The concert included tributes to the outgoing Australians of the Year with songs chosen by the previous Australians of the Year. This was followed by the Australian of the Year Awards ceremony.
Once the Awards ceremony was complete, the concert continued with each artist performing a full set of music.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.australiaday.org.au/australia-day/australia-celebrates-live-2014/ |title=Archived copy |accessdate=2014-05-07 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20140430065510/http://www.australiaday.org.au/australia-day/australia-celebrates-live-2014/ |archivedate=30 April 2014 }}</ref>
== Cancellation of the Australia Celebrates Live concert == In August 2016 the National Australia Day Council announced that the '''Australia Celebrates Live''' has been cancelled from 2017.<ref>http://www.abc.net.au/news/2016-08-24/australia-day-public-concert-held-in-canberra-scrapped/7779318</ref>
